explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being sulfonyls, containing chemical groups with self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (used as laundry detergents (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment, 2006))

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to the elements other than carbon and hydrogen.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 438mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 438mg/kg (RTECS (2006)), 500mg/kg and 2,000mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (24 hour application) (RTECS (2006)): "Causes moderate irritation." Also based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests performed in accordance with OECD TG 404 (IUCLID (2000)): "Irritating to the skin." Although the results are not those of 4 hour application, the substance is considered to be a moderate irritant and classified into Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (RTECS (2006)): "24 hour application of 250microg induced severe irritation reactions," "1% solution produced severe irritation." Also based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests performed in accordance with OECD TG 405 (IUCLID (2000)): "Irritating to the eye." The substance is thus considered a severe eye irritant.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory Sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin Sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-20 (2002) and CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.5 (2004)): "Skin sensitization: positive" (linear alkylbenzenesulfonate and its salts (the carbon chain length unknown); No data available on sodium dodecylbenzenesulphonate per se).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data (no definite data are available regarding sodium dodecylbenzenesulphonate per se). As for linear alkylbenzene sulphonate (LAS) and its salts [carbon chain lengths of 10-14 and their mixtures], no data are available on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, whereas multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests), somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests, chromosome aberration tests) and Ames assay gave negative results, described in NTP DB (Access on June, 2006), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.5 (2005) and EHC 169 (1996).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible based on expert judgment in the absence of existing classification together with the absence of definite data on sodium dodecylbenzenesulphonate per se. CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.5 (2005) presents some data regarding carcinogenicity studies on linear alkylbenzene sulphonate (LAS) and its salts [carbon chain lengths of 10-14 and their mixtures].

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data (no definite data are available regarding sodium dodecylbenzenesulphonate per se). As for linear alkylbenzene sulphonate (LAS) and its salts [carbon chain lengths of 10-14 and their mixtures], there was no evidence of adverse effects on the parental animals and the offspring observed in oral studies, whereas decreased fertility and increased incidence of malformation in the offspring were observed at doses inducing parental toxicity in dermal studies, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.5 (2005) and EHC 169 (1996).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale:
Based on the description in ICSC (J) (1997): "Causes respiratory irritation."
Note: As for linear alkylbenzene sulphonate (LAS) and its salts [carbon chain lengths of 10-14 and their mixtures], "clinical symptoms include confusion, vomiting, pharyngal and oral pains, and the tendency of blood pressure to decrease" (NITE Initial Risk Assessment No.5 (2005)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to the fact that the only available data are those for mixtures of C10-14.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours EC50=0.9mg/L of the blue algae (Microcystis) (EHC169, 1996).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition of p-n-dodecylbenzenesulfonic acid sodium salt by BOD: 73% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=1.96(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
